definition: to compete to answer questions (in class)
to compete/to contend/to struggle
to answer/to agree
reply/answer/return/respond/echo

sentences.english: The students compete with each other to answer the teacher's questions.
sentences.chinese: 同学们在竞答老师提出的问题。

definition: to compete to be the first to answer a question (as on a quiz show)
to try to answer a question (in a quiz, guessing game, riddle etc)/quiz game
question and answer
(usually used in the negative) to answer or reply to sb's question
to draw a prize/a lottery/a raffle
award/prize
preliminary contest/initial heats of a competition
to make learning fun/to combine education and entertainment
entire population (of a country)
lucky draw/lottery
to draw up the theme (for discussion)
race/competition/CL:個|个[ge4]

beat the drum, pass the flower (game in which players sit in a circle passing a flower around while a drum is beaten – when the drumbeat stops, the player holding the flower must sing a song, answer a question, or drink a glass of wine etc)
live broadcast (not recorded)/direct Internet broadcasting/(agriculture) direct seeding
talent show
(sports) semifinal or quarterfinal/to compete in a semifinal (or a quarterfinal)
